intro: Chrysoglossum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan chrysoglossum, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months.
